Zlatan Ibrahimovic’s Manchester United career is all but over after the forward reportedly rejected a new £13m-a-year deal to stay at Old Trafford.
The Swede, 35, is expected to be sidelined for up to a year after sustaining ‘significant’ damage to his knee ligaments in United’s win against Anderlecht last week.

United were keen to tie Ibrahimovic down to a new one-year deal and, according to the Sun, the club did not withdraw their offer after discovering the extent of the Swede’s injury.

Ibrahimovic, though, has turned down the £250,000-a-week deal because he doesn’t believe he deserves the money while he’s on the long road back in recovery.

"The manager decides his squad and chooses a certain number of players to face the season, and that's it. I normally like to work with 20 players plus the three goalkeepers, which is what I do for 15 years," he said.

David De Gea has told Manchester United that he wants a world-record transfer move to Real Madrid in the summer, according to reports in Spain.
